item.title: 'Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy': PM Modi - News18
item.description:
Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy

Date: January 04, 2025   Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that the Indian government's initiatives are energizing rural India, aiming to empower communities and transform villages into hubs of growth.

  • PM Modi spoke at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025, celebrating rural India's resilience.
  • He highlighted increasing accessibility to healthcare services in rural areas.
  • An approximate Rs. 3 lakh crore in financial assistance has been provided to farmers under the PM-KISAN scheme.
“During the COVID pandemic, the world doubted how Indian villages would tackle the crisis, but we ensured vaccines reached the last person in every village.” – PM Modi

The Prime Minister's remarks reflect ongoing government efforts to enhance rural infrastructure and economic stability, aiming for a 'Viksit Bharat' (Developed India) by 2047.

item.title: 'Went here and there…': On Lalu Yadav's offer, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar says won't repeat ‘mistake’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Nitish Kumar Rejects Lalu Yadav's Alliance Offer, Reflects on Bihar's Progress

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar criticizes the previous government led by Lalu Prasad Yadav while rejecting an alliance offer, emphasizing Bihar's development since 2005.

  • Nitish Kumar attacks Lalu Prasad's government pre-2005, citing poor conditions in Bihar.
  • He highlights significant improvements in education, health, and infrastructure under his leadership.
  • Kumar's review meeting underscores commitment to continuing development without alliances.
  • Lalu Yadav extended an invitation for partnership in the 'Mahagathbandan', but Kumar declined.
  • Tejashwi Yadav, Lalu's son, downplays Lalu's invitation, suggesting it was merely a response to media inquiries.
“Before the year 2005, Bihar ki halat kaafi kharab thi (the condition of Bihar was really bad).” - Nitish Kumar

Kumar's remarks underline a significant political divide in Bihar as he positions himself as a leader focused on development without reliance on past alliances.

item.title: Metro section, first Namo Bharat connectivity: PM Modi to flag off big projects in Delhi on Jan 5 | Details - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi to Launch Over ₹12,200 Crore in Development Projects in Delhi

Date: January 4, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 5, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate various development projects worth over ₹12,200 crore in Delhi, ahead of the assembly elections.

  • The inaugural 13-kilometer Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut Namo Bharat Rapid Rail corridor is valued at ₹4,600 crore and will enhance connectivity between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar.
  • The Prime Minister will also open a 2.8 km stretch of Delhi Metro Phase-IV between Janakpuri and Krishna Park, costing about ₹1,200 crore.
  • Additional projects include the foundation stone for the 26.5 km Rithala - Kundli section of Delhi Metro Phase-IV, worth ₹6,230 crore, and a new building for the Central Ayurveda Research Institute at a cost of ₹185 crore.
“This will significantly ease travel between Delhi and Meerut and will benefit millions of people through high-speed and comfortable travel along with unmatched safety and reliability.”

The commencement of these projects is expected to provide numerous benefits to residents and improve overall infrastructure in the region.

item.title: Dense fog grips Delhi, visibility drops to zero for record nine hours; over 400 flights delayed - The Times of India
item.description:
Dense fog grips Delhi, visibility drops to zero for record nine hours; over 400 flights delayed

Publication Date: [add publication date here] Source: [add source here]

The national capital experienced unprecedented dense fog that resulted in zero visibility for nine hours, leading to significant disruptions in air traffic.

  • Visibility in Delhi dropped to zero, marking a record duration of nine hours.
  • Over 400 flights were delayed due to the weather conditions.
  • Travelers faced severe inconveniences as many were unable to reach their destinations on time.
"The situation was unprecedented; we have not seen such dense fog in years," said a local meteorologist.

This severe weather event highlights the challenges posed by winter fog in urban areas and its impact on public transport.

item.title: Atul Subhash suicide case: Wife Nikita Singhania, her mother and brother get bail - The Times of India
item.description:
Atul Subhash suicide case: Wife Nikita Singhania, her mother and brother get bail

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Times of India

The article discusses the bail granted to Nikita Singhania and her family members in the case surrounding the suicide of Atul Subhash.

  • Nikita Singhania, along with her mother and brother, were granted bail.
  • Details surrounding the circumstances of Atul Subhash's death are highlighted.
  • The family's allegations against Nikita are also mentioned.
“We are relieved by the court’s decision.” - Family spokesperson

The conclusion emphasizes the ongoing legal proceedings and the impact of this case on those involved.

item.title: Delhi fog: City sees season's longest zero visibility spell; 400 flights delayed - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Fog: City Sees Season's Longest Zero Visibility Spell; 400 Flights Delayed

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025 11:50 PM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog enveloped Delhi on Saturday, leading to zero visibility for nine hours—the longest spell this season. The weather caused significant disruptions at the airport, including numerous flight delays and cancellations.

  • Visibility dropped to zero for nine hours affecting all flight operations.
  • Over 400 flights were delayed, with 19 flights diverted and 45 cancellations.
  • The city's primary weather station recorded eight hours of zero visibility.
  • Temperatures recorded were a maximum of 20 degrees Celsius and a minimum of 7.8 degrees Celsius.
  • The air quality index (AQI) stood at 378, indicating very poor air quality.
"Zero visibility prevailed for nine hours at Palam between 6 pm and 3 am (UTC), marking the longest spell of the season."

In conclusion, the persistent fog in Delhi severely impacted air travel, highlighting the need for enhanced weather preparedness.

item.title: Manipur Governor reviews security, tribal body extends shutdown - The Hindu
item.description:
Manipur Governor Reviews Security as Tribal Body Extends Shutdown

Published on: January 04, 2025 08:09 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla reviewed the State’s security situation just after taking office, amid rising tensions following mob violence in Kangpokpi district.

  • The Governor assessed security arrangements with senior officials, directing prioritization of public safety.
  • Protests erupted in response to the deployment of central forces in tribal areas, leading to renewed shutdowns by the Committee on Tribal Unity.
  • The tribal group is dissatisfied with perceived disregard for their rights by the government.
  • In addition, a proposal for building 15,000 homes for displaced persons has been initiated due to ongoing ethnic conflict.
“The Governor instructed the Director General of Police to prioritize the safety and security of the people...”

This situation highlights the conflict's ongoing impact on local governance and community relations in Manipur.

item.title: 'Take it away, give me Rs 25 lakh per day instead': Prashant Kishor on row over vanity van at BPSC protes - The Times of India
item.description:
Take it away, give me Rs 25 lakh per day instead: Prashant Kishor on row over vanity van at BPSC protest site

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Prashant Kishor caused a stir during his protest at the BPSC site, addressing the controversy surrounding vanity vans.

  • Kishor responds to criticism regarding the use of vanity vans at protest sites.
  • He humorously suggests a monetary compensation alternative.
  • The protest has gained significant media attention and sparked public debates.
"Take it away, give me Rs 25 lakh per day instead" - Prashant Kishor

The incident highlights ongoing discussions about protest logistics and public perceptions of political figures.

item.title: BPSC exam row: ‘Vanity van’ near Prashant Kishor’s protest site in Patna sparks controversy - The Hindu
item.description:
Controversy Over 'Vanity Van' at Prashant Kishor’s Protest in Patna

Published Date: January 04, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Controversy erupted on January 4, 2025, over a 'vanity van' parked near the protest site of Prashant Kishor in Patna, where he is conducting a hunger strike over allegations of a questioned paper leak in the BPSC exam.

  • The vanity van, equipped with luxury facilities, raised eyebrows as it was located close to Gandhi Maidan, where Kishor's protest commenced on January 2, 2025.
  • Kishor highlighted the discrepancy between his protest and the lavish amenities, questioning the significance of restroom facilities compared to the future of BPSC aspirants.
  • A legal protest notice was issued by the district administration claiming the gathering was illegal as per a High Court order.
  • Over the last three weeks, several demonstrators have been actively advocating for a cancellation of the examination.
“I want to convey this through mediapersons... let this van be taken away and in return, give me ₹25 lakh per day and provide an alternate space that can be used as a washroom.” - Prashant Kishor

The situation surrounding Mr. Kishor's protest continues to be contentious, with authorities warning of actions against him and his supporters.

item.title: Prashant Kishor reacts to ' ₹2 crore vanity van' charge at BPSC protest: 'To relieve myself...' - Hindustan Times

item.title: Congress launches ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan’ campaign targeting Shah for ‘insulting’ Ambedkar - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress launches ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan’ campaign targeting Shah for ‘insulting’ Ambedkar

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Congress has initiated a campaign demanding the resignation of Home Minister Amit Shah over his comments deemed insulting to B.R. Ambedkar. The campaign, titled ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan,’ spans from January 3 to January 26, culminating in a rally in Mhow, Ambedkar's birthplace.

  • The campaign encourages village-level meetings to educate the public about alleged insults toward Ambedkar and the Constitution.
  • The initial rally was postponed due to national mourning for former PM Manmohan Singh.
  • Demands include Shah's resignation for derogatory remarks made about Ambedkar.
  • Accusations include the BJP’s attempts to demonize national leaders and undermine democracy.
“We reiterate our demand to sack Home Minister Amit Shah for his derogatory remarks against Dr. Ambedkar.” - Pawan Khera

This campaign underscores growing tensions between the Congress and BJP regarding the legacy of Dr. Ambedkar and other national leaders.

item.title: Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar murder case: Family members detained, Congress leader Suresh Chandrakar’s as - The Times of India
item.description:
Murder Case of Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar: Family Detained, Congress Leader's Assets Seized

Publication Date: October 5, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Following the murder of journalist Mukesh Chandrakar, family members have been detained and assets of Congress leader Suresh Chandrakar have been seized as investigations continue.

  • Mukesh Chandrakar was a prominent journalist known for his investigative reports.
  • The recent developments follow intense scrutiny of the political connections and motives behind the murder.
  • Authorities are increasing their focus on the role of political figures in the ongoing investigation.
"This tragic loss has left a void in the journalism community. We call for justice and thorough investigations into this case." - A fellow journalist

The investigations surrounding the murder of Mukesh Chandrakar reflect growing concerns over journalist safety and political corruption in the region.

item.title: Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's wife Nikita, mother-in-law Nishan and brother-in-law Anurag granted bail in suicide case | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

Publication Date: Saturday
Source: ANI

Bengaluru's City Civil Court has granted bail to Nikita Singhania, the wife of deceased techie Atul Subhash, along with her mother Nisha and brother Anurag, who were accused in his suicide case.

  • Nikita was arrested in Gurugram, while her family members were apprehended in Prayagraj.
  • They were held in custody following the discovery of a suicide note and video of Atul.
  • The lawyer mentioned that the suicide note and video have been sent for forensic analysis.
  • The bail was granted amid claims of harassment and emotional distress from Atul's side.
  • There are plans to challenge the bail order in the High Court of Karnataka.
“We will challenge it (bail order)... After seeing the order sheet, and analysing it, we can approach the High Court of Karnataka.” - Vinay Singh, Advocate

Atul Subhash, who worked for a private company, had left behind a detailed suicide note citing marital issues. His case highlights ongoing concerns around emotional distress and legal disputes in relationships.

item.title: Wife, her mother and brother get bail in case of abetting Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's suicide - NDTV
item.description:
Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

Date: Today | Source: Bengaluru Court

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in the abetment of suicide case against them following Subhash's suicide on December 9.

  • Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania and her family were accused of harassment leading to his death.
  • They had previously appealed to the Karnataka High Court for expedited bail proceedings.
  • Subhash left a video and a detailed note accusing his wife and her relatives of torturing him.
  • Nikita was arrested in Gurugram; her family members were arrested in Prayagraj.
  • The parents of Subhash are seeking custody of their grandson.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” said Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father.

This case raises serious concerns about marital harassment and the mental health of individuals facing familial pressures.

item.title: BJP Candidates List for Delhi Elections 2025: Full list of Bharatiya Janata Party candidates for Delhi polls - The Indian Express
item.description:
BJP Candidates List for Delhi Elections 2025

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Indian Express

More about the candidates:

The Bharatiya Janata Party has announced its candidate list for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections in 2025, showcasing a mix of experienced politicians and new faces across various constituencies.

  • Raj Kumar Bhatia will contest from Adarsh Nagar against AAP's Mukesh Goel.
  • Kulwant Rana, a former BJP vice president, will contest from Rithala.
  • Manoj Shokeen has been the president of Outer Delhi BJP since 2017 and is contesting from Nangloi Jat.
  • Rajkumar Chauhan, a former Congress MLA, will run from Mangolpuri.
  • Vijender Gupta, the current MLA from Rohini, is running again from that constituency.
  • Rekha Gupta, a member of BJP National Executive, is contesting from Shalimar Bagh.
  • Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma will contest against AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal from New Delhi.
  • Ramesh Bhiduri will challenge CM Atishi from Kalkaji.
The announcement indicates the BJP's strategy to consolidate its power in Delhi amidst strong competition from the AAP.

With a diverse candidate list, the BJP aims to secure key positions in the upcoming elections and strengthen its influence in Delhi's political landscape.

item.title: Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Wife, In-Laws Get Bail In Abetment Of Suicide Case - NDTV
item.description:
Bengaluru Court Grants Bail to Atul Subhash's Wife and In-Laws in Suicide Case

Publication Date: Today Source: Local News

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in an abetment of suicide case.

  • Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9, citing harassment from his wife and her family.
  • His wife Nikita, her mother Nisha, and brother Anurag were granted bail after an appeal to the session court.
  • On December 14, the wife and in-laws were arrested in connection with the case.
  • Subhash left behind a video and note detailing harassment, extortion, and allegations against his wife and her relatives.
  • His parents are seeking custody of their four-year-old grandson, expressing concerns for his welfare.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note also mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” - Pawan Kumar, father of Atul Subhash.

This case highlights the serious issues surrounding domestic violence and mental health, prompting public discussion on the responsibilities of family members in such scenarios.

item.title: Kejriwal promises to waive 'inflated' water bills, if AAP wins Delhi polls - The Times of India
item.description:
Kejriwal Promises to Waive 'Inflated' Water Bills If AAP Wins Delhi Polls

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has vowed to waive off what he calls 'inflated' water bills if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) retains power in the upcoming elections. This promise is part of the party's campaign strategy aimed at addressing the grievances of Delhi residents regarding high water charges.

  • Kejriwal's assurance targets the issue of inflated water bills in Delhi.
  • The waiver proposal is positioned as a key aspect of AAP's electoral campaign.
  • The party aims to garner support from voters affected by rising utility costs.
“If AAP wins, we will cancel all unnecessary water charges and ensure that residents pay only for the actual water consumed,” stated Kejriwal.

The AAP aims to strengthen its hold in the Delhi assembly by emphasizing issues of utility affordability and civic welfare.

item.title: Delhi polls: Arvind Kejriwal alleges ‘covert, behind-the-scenes’ alliance between BJP, Congress - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP and Congress of Secret Alliance Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal, the national convenor of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), has accused the BJP and Congress of maintaining a covert alliance ahead of the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, amidst strained relations between AAP and Congress.

  • Kejriwal calls for BJP and Congress to officially announce their alliance.
  • The relationship between AAP and Congress has soured after failed coalition attempts in the Haryana elections.
  • Protests occurred outside Kejriwal’s residence over delayed financial promises to women in Punjab.
  • Kejriwal alleges the protesting women were sent by BJP and Congress.
  • Controversy arises over the financial aid promise to women as the Mahila Samman Yojana is under investigation.
“The Congress and the BJP should officially declare that they are contesting the elections against AAP in an alliance. This covert, behind-the-scenes collaboration is unacceptable.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The allegations and subsequent protests highlight the contentious political atmosphere in Delhi as elections approach, with Kejriwal emphasizing the need for transparency in party alliances.

item.title: Delhi: Class 9 student stabbed to death after fight with schoolmate over ball hit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Fatal Stabbing Outside Delhi School: 14-Year-Old Dies After Fight with Classmate

Date & Source: Jan 04, 2025 08:54 PM IST, HT News Desk, Hindustan Times

In a tragic incident, a 14-year-old boy identified as Ishu Gupta was stabbed to death outside the Rajkiya Sarvodaya Bal Vidyalaya in Shakarpur, Delhi after a fight with a classmate. The altercation started over a ball hit during a break at school.

The classmate, enraged after being hit by the ball, borrowed a mobile phone and made a call, discussing a dispute with the victim and instructing the person on the line to 'send people'. Later, as students left the school, the accused classmate was seen waiting outside with a group, including an accomplice who stabbed the victim in his right thigh, causing severe injuries.

The victim was rushed to the hospital but succumbed to his injuries. Seven suspects, including five juveniles, a 19-year-old college student, and a 31-year-old dairy shop owner, were apprehended, and the knife used in the murder was recovered.

item.title: When Chhattisgarh Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar Helped In Release Of Abducted CRPF Jawan - News18
item.description:
Chhattisgarh Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar's Role in the Release of Abducted CRPF Jawan

Published on: January 04, 2025, Source: News18

Mukesh Chandrakar, a journalist in Chhattisgarh, was instrumental in the release of CRPF commando Rakeshwar Singh Manhas, who was abducted by Maoists during an encounter in 2021.

  • Mukesh Chandrakar’s efforts were recognized by the state police for securing the release of the abducted CRPF personnel.
  • Chandrakar was also known for his investigative reporting on corruption in the Bastar region.
  • He was found dead in a water tank on January 4, 2025, after going missing since January 1.
  • His disappearance followed an investigation into alleged irregularities in a ₹120-crore road construction project.
“The victim’s brother informed us yesterday that Mukesh had been missing since January 1. We initiated action, scanned CCTV footage, and also found his last location. We found Mukesh’s dead body inside a tank in the evening today.”

The life and work of Mukesh Chandrakar highlight the risks journalists face while reporting in conflict zones and their commitment to uncovering the truth.

item.title: Tamil Nadu govt. declares holiday on January 17 - The Hindu
item.description:
Tamil Nadu Government Declares Holiday on January 17 for Pongal Celebrations

Publication Date: January 4, 2025 Source: The Hindu

On January 4, 2025, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced a holiday on January 17, 2025, for government offices, public sector undertakings, schools, and colleges across the state in light of the Pongal festival.

  • The Pongal festival is celebrated on January 15, with holidays on the 16th, 18th, and 19th.
  • The decision to declare January 17 as a holiday was made following requests from government employees and students who will be traveling to their native places to celebrate the festival.
"As a lot of government employees and students will go to their native places to celebrate Pongal, there was a request to declare a holiday on January 17 as well. The government has considered their request and declared a holiday on January 17," said Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

This decision reflects the government's responsiveness to the cultural significance of Pongal and the needs of its citizens.

item.title: MLA Uma Thomas accident: Kerala court grants interim bail to accused event organizer - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Kerala Court Grants Interim Bail to Event Organizer Accused in MLA Uma Thomas Accident

Publication Date: January 2, 2025

Source: Bar & Bench

The trial court granted interim bail to Nigosh Kumar, accused of causing severe injuries to MLA Uma Thomas during a large public event.

  • The incident occurred on December 29, 2024, at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium during a record-setting Bharatanatyam performance.
  • Thomas fell 15 feet while attempting to take her seat in the VIP section, resulting in critical injuries.
  • Event organizers faced allegations of inadequate safety measures.
  • Kumar and another accused initially sought anticipatory bail from the Kerala High Court but were required to surrender to the police.
  • Kumar was formally arrested on January 2, 2025.
  • His counsel argued he was falsely implicated and that there was no intent to harm.
  • The magistrate granted interim bail until January 7, 2025, after considering the defense's arguments.
“The allegations of negligence regarding the construction of pathways and barricades for VIP seating did not justify invoking Section 110 of the BNS.”

This case highlights significant concerns regarding public event safety and organizer accountability.
